name: DwC
title: Darwin Core Recommended Terms
description: This document contains a list of Darwin Core terms that have the dwcattributes:status equal to "recommended". For the full normative RDF document of all Darwin Core terms, see dwctermshistory.rdf. To comment on this schema, please create a new issue in https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues

terms.name: acceptedNameUsage
terms.title: Accepted Name Usage
terms.description: The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

terms.name: acceptedNameUsageID
terms.title: Accepted Name Usage ID
terms.description: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) taxon.

terms.name: accordingTo
terms.title: According To
terms.description: Abstract term to attribute information to a source.

terms.name: associatedMedia
terms.title: Associated Media
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of media associated with the Occurrence.

terms.name: associatedOccurrences
terms.title: Associated Occurrences
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Occurrence records and their associations to this Occurrence.

terms.name: associatedOrganisms
terms.title: Associated Organisms
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers of other Organisms and their associations to this Organism.

terms.name: associatedReferences
terms.title: Associated References
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the Occurrence.

terms.name: associatedSequences
terms.title: Associated Sequences
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the Occurrence.

terms.name: associatedTaxa
terms.title: Associated Taxa
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers or names of taxa and their associations with the Occurrence.

terms.name: basisOfRecord
terms.title: Basis of Record
terms.description: The specific nature of the data record.

terms.name: bed
terms.title: Bed
terms.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic bed from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: behavior
terms.title: Behavior
terms.description: A description of the behavior shown by the subject at the time the Occurrence was recorded.  Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: catalogNumber
terms.title: Catalog Number
terms.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

terms.name: class
terms.title: Class
terms.description: The full scientific name of the class in which the taxon is classified.

terms.name: collectionCode
terms.title: Collection Code
terms.description: The name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived.

terms.name: collectionID
terms.title: Collection ID
terms.description: An identifier for the collection or dataset from which the record was derived.

terms.name: continent
terms.title: Continent
terms.description: The name of the continent in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

terms.name: coordinatePrecision
terms.title: Coordinate Precision
terms.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude.

terms.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
terms.title: Coordinate Uncertainty In Meters
terms.description: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

terms.name: country
terms.title: Country
terms.description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

terms.name: countryCode
terms.title: Country Code
terms.description: The standard code for the country in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country codes.

terms.name: county
terms.title: County
terms.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

terms.name: dataGeneralizations
terms.title: Data Generalizations
terms.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.

terms.name: datasetID
terms.title: Dataset ID
terms.description: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

terms.name: datasetName
terms.title: Dataset Name
terms.description: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

terms.name: dateIdentified
terms.title: Date Identified
terms.description: The date on which the subject was identified as representing the Taxon. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

terms.name: day
terms.title: Day
terms.description: The integer day of the month on which the Event occurred.

terms.name: decimalLatitude
terms.title: Decimal Latitude
terms.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

terms.name: decimalLongitude
terms.title: Decimal Longitude
terms.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

terms.name: disposition
terms.title: Disposition
terms.description: The current state of a specimen with respect to the collection identified in collectionCode or collectionID. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: dynamicProperties
terms.title: Dynamic Properties
terms.description: A list of additional measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions about the record. Meant to provide a mechanism for structured content.

terms.name: earliestAgeOrLowestStage
terms.title: Earliest Age Or Lowest Stage
terms.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic age or lowest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: earliestEonOrLowestEonothem
terms.title: Earliest Eon Or Lowest Eonothem
terms.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic eon or lowest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: earliestEpochOrLowestSeries
terms.title: Earliest Epoch Or Lowest Series
terms.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic epoch or lowest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: earliestEraOrLowestErathem
terms.title: Earliest Era Or Lowest Erathem
terms.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic era or lowest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: earliestPeriodOrLowestSystem
terms.title: Earliest Period Or Lowest System
terms.description: The full name of the earliest possible geochronologic period or lowest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: endDayOfYear
terms.title: End Day Of Year
terms.description: The latest ordinal day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

terms.name: establishmentMeans
terms.title: Establishment Means
terms.description: The process by which the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence became established at the location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: Event
terms.title: Event
terms.description: An action that occurs at some location during some time.

terms.name: eventDate
terms.title: Event Date
terms.description: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

terms.name: eventID
terms.title: Event ID
terms.description: An identifier for the set of information associated with an Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

terms.name: eventRemarks
terms.title: Event Remarks
terms.description: Comments or notes about the Event.

terms.name: eventTime
terms.title: Event Time
terms.description: The time or interval during which an Event occurred. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

terms.name: family
terms.title: Family
terms.description: The full scientific name of the family in which the taxon is classified.

terms.name: fieldNotes
terms.title: Field Notes
terms.description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the Event.

terms.name: fieldNumber
terms.title: Field Number
terms.description: An identifier given to the event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the Event.

terms.name: footprintSpatialFit
terms.title: Footprint Spatial Fit
terms.description: The ratio of the area of the footprint (footprintWKT) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given footprint does not completely contain the original representation. The footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left blank) if the original representation is a point and the given georeference is not that same point. If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the footprintSpatialFit is 1.

terms.name: footprintSRS
terms.title: Footprint SRS
terms.description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the Spatial Reference System (SRS) for the footprintWKT of the Location. Do not use this term to describe the SRS of the decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude, even if it is the same as for the footprintWKT - use the geodeticDatum instead.

terms.name: footprintWKT
terms.title: Footprint WKT
terms.description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines the Location. A Location may have both a point-radius representation (see decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.

terms.name: formation
terms.title: Formation
terms.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic formation from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: FossilSpecimen
terms.title: Fossil Specimen
terms.description: A preserved specimen that is a fossil.

terms.name: genus
terms.title: Genus
terms.description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the taxon is classified.

terms.name: geodeticDatum
terms.title: Geodetic Datum
terms.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based. Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value "unknown".

terms.name: GeologicalContext
terms.title: Geological Context
terms.description: Geological information, such as stratigraphy, that qualifies a region or place.

terms.name: geologicalContextID
terms.title: Geological Context ID
terms.description: An identifier for the set of information associated with a GeologicalContext (the location within a geological context, such as stratigraphy). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

terms.name: georeferencedBy
terms.title: Georeferenced By
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the Location.

terms.name: georeferencedDate
terms.title: Georeferenced Date
terms.description: The date on which the Location was georeferenced. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

terms.name: georeferenceProtocol
terms.title: Georeference Protocol
terms.description: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.

terms.name: georeferenceRemarks
terms.title: Georeference Remarks
terms.description: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in georeferenceProtocol.

terms.name: georeferenceSources
terms.title: Georeference Sources
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

terms.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
terms.title: Georeference Verification Status
terms.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: group
terms.title: Group
terms.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic group from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: habitat
terms.title: Habitat
terms.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

terms.name: higherClassification
terms.title: Higher Classification
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa names terminating at the rank immediately superior to the taxon referenced in the taxon record.

terms.name: higherGeography
terms.title: Higher Geography
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the locality term.

terms.name: higherGeographyID
terms.title: Higher Geography ID
terms.description: An identifier for the geographic region within which the Location occurred. Recommended best practice is to use an persistent identifier from a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

terms.name: highestBiostratigraphicZone
terms.title: Highest Biostratigraphic Zone
terms.description: The full name of the highest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: HumanObservation
terms.title: Human Observation
terms.description: An output of a human observation process.

terms.name: Identification
terms.title: Identification
terms.description: A taxonomic determination (e.g., the assignment to a taxon).

terms.name: identificationID
terms.title: Identification ID
terms.description: An identifier for the Identification (the body of information associated with the assignment of a scientific name). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

terms.name: identificationQualifier
terms.title: Identification Qualifier
terms.description: A brief phrase or a standard term ("cf.", "aff.") to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification.

terms.name: identificationReferences
terms.title: Identification References
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the Identification.

terms.name: identificationRemarks
terms.title: Identification Remarks
terms.description: Comments or notes about the Identification.

terms.name: identificationVerificationStatus
terms.title: Identification Verification Status
terms.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which the taxonomic identification has been verified to be correct. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID/ABCD.

terms.name: identifiedBy
terms.title: Identified By
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.

terms.name: individualCount
terms.title: Individual Count
terms.description: The number of individuals represented present at the time of the Occurrence.

terms.name: informationWithheld
terms.title: Information Withheld
terms.description: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.

terms.name: infraspecificEpithet
terms.title: Infraspecific Epithet
terms.description: The name of the lowest or terminal infraspecific epithet of the scientificName, excluding any rank designation.

terms.name: institutionCode
terms.title: Institution Code
terms.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

terms.name: institutionID
terms.title: Institution ID
terms.description: An identifier for the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

terms.name: island
terms.title: Island
terms.description: The name of the island on or near which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

terms.name: islandGroup
terms.title: Island Group
terms.description: The name of the island group in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

terms.name: kingdom
terms.title: Kingdom
terms.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.

terms.name: latestAgeOrHighestStage
terms.title: Latest AgeOr Highest Stage
terms.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic age or highest chronostratigraphic stage attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: latestEonOrHighestEonothem
terms.title: Latest Eon Or Highest Eonothem
terms.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic eon or highest chrono-stratigraphic eonothem or the informal name ("Precambrian") attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: latestEpochOrHighestSeries
terms.title: Latest Epoch Or Highest Series
terms.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic epoch or highest chronostratigraphic series attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: latestEraOrHighestErathem
terms.title: Latest Era Or Highest Erathem
terms.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic era or highest chronostratigraphic erathem attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: latestPeriodOrHighestSystem
terms.title: Latest Period Or Highest System
terms.description: The full name of the latest possible geochronologic period or highest chronostratigraphic system attributable to the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: lifeStage
terms.title: Life Stage
terms.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: lithostratigraphicTerms
terms.title: Lithostratigraphic Terms
terms.description: The combination of all litho-stratigraphic names for the rock from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: LivingSpecimen
terms.title: Living Specimen
terms.description: A specimen that is alive.

terms.name: locality
terms.title: Locality
terms.description: The specific description of the place. Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (higherGeography, continent, country, stateProvince, county, municipality, waterBody, island, islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.

terms.name: locationAccordingTo
terms.title: Location According To
terms.description: Information about the source of this Location information. Could be a publication (gazetteer), institution, or team of individuals.

terms.name: locationID
terms.title: Location ID
terms.description: An identifier for the set of location information (data associated with dcterms:Location). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

terms.name: locationRemarks
terms.title: Location Remarks
terms.description: Comments or notes about the Location.

terms.name: lowestBiostratigraphicZone
terms.title: Lowest Biostratigraphic Zone
terms.description: The full name of the lowest possible geological biostratigraphic zone of the stratigraphic horizon from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: MachineObservation
terms.title: Machine Observation
terms.description: An output of a machine observation process.

terms.name: MaterialSample
terms.title: Material Sample
terms.description: A physical results of a sampling (or subsampling) event. In biological collections, the material sample is typically collected, and either preserved or destructively processed.

terms.name: materialSampleID
terms.title: Material Sample ID
terms.description: An identifier for the MaterialSample (as opposed to a particular digital record of the material sample). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the materialSampleID globally unique.

terms.name: maximumDepthInMeters
terms.title: Maximum Depth In Meters
terms.description: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

terms.name: maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
terms.title: Maximum Distance Above Surface In Meters
terms.description: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.

terms.name: maximumElevationInMeters
terms.title: Maximum Elevation In Meters
terms.description: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

terms.name: measurementAccuracy
terms.title: Measurement Accuracy
terms.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

terms.name: measurementDeterminedBy
terms.title: Measurement Determined By
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the value of the MeasurementOrFact.

terms.name: measurementDeterminedDate
terms.title: Measurement Determined Date
terms.description: The date on which the MeasurementOrFact was made. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

terms.name: measurementID
terms.title: Measurement ID
terms.description: An identifier for the MeasurementOrFact (information pertaining to measurements, facts, characteristics, or assertions). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

terms.name: measurementMethod
terms.title: Measurement Method
terms.description: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used to determine the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

terms.name: MeasurementOrFact
terms.title: Measurement or Fact
terms.description: A measurement of or fact about an rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource).

terms.name: measurementRemarks
terms.title: Measurement Remarks
terms.description: Comments or notes accompanying the MeasurementOrFact.

terms.name: measurementType
terms.title: Measurement Type
terms.description: The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: measurementUnit
terms.title: Measurement Unit
terms.description: The units associated with the measurementValue. Recommended best practice is to use the International System of Units (SI).

terms.name: measurementValue
terms.title: Measurement Value
terms.description: The value of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.

terms.name: member
terms.title: Member
terms.description: The full name of the lithostratigraphic member from which the cataloged item was collected.

terms.name: minimumDepthInMeters
terms.title: Minimum Depth In Meters
terms.description: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

terms.name: minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
terms.title: Minimum Distance Above Surface In Meters
terms.description: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.

terms.name: minimumElevationInMeters
terms.title: Minimum Elevation In Meters
terms.description: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

terms.name: month
terms.title: Month
terms.description: The ordinal month in which the Event occurred.

terms.name: municipality
terms.title: Municipality
terms.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual location.

terms.name: nameAccordingTo
terms.title: Name According To
terms.description: The reference to the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied - traditionally signified by the Latin "sensu" or "sec." (from secundum, meaning "according to"). For taxa that result from identifications, a reference to the keys, monographs, experts and other sources should be given.

terms.name: nameAccordingToID
terms.title: Name According To ID
terms.description: An identifier for the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied. See nameAccordingTo.

terms.name: namePublishedIn
terms.title: Name Published In
terms.description: A reference for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

terms.name: namePublishedInID
terms.title: Name Published In ID
terms.description: An identifier for the publication in which the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

terms.name: namePublishedInYear
terms.title: Name Published In Year
terms.description: The four-digit year in which the scientificName was published.

terms.name: nomenclaturalCode
terms.title: Nomenclatural Code
terms.description: The nomenclatural code (or codes in the case of an ambiregnal name) under which the scientificName is constructed. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: nomenclaturalStatus
terms.title: Nomenclatural Status
terms.description: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code.  It requires no taxonomic opinion.

terms.name: Occurrence
terms.title: Occurrence
terms.description: An existence of an Organism (sensu http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/Organism) at a particular place at a particular time.

terms.name: occurrenceID
terms.title: Occurrence ID
terms.description: An identifier for the Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the occurrenceID globally unique.

terms.name: occurrenceRemarks
terms.title: Occurrence Remarks
terms.description: Comments or notes about the Occurrence.

terms.name: occurrenceStatus
terms.title: Occurrence Status
terms.description: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: order
terms.title: Order
terms.description: The full scientific name of the order in which the taxon is classified.

terms.name: Organism
terms.title: Organism
terms.description: A particular organism or defined group of organisms considered to be taxonomically homogeneous.

terms.name: organismID
terms.title: Organism ID
terms.description: An identifier for the Organism instance (as opposed to a particular digital record of the Organism). May be a globally unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

terms.name: organismName
terms.title: Organism Name
terms.description: A textual name or label assigned to an Organism instance.

terms.name: organismQuantity
terms.title: Organism Quantity
terms.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.

terms.name: organismQuantityType
terms.title: Organism Quantity Type
terms.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity of organisms.

terms.name: organismRemarks
terms.title: Organism Remarks
terms.description: Comments or notes about the Organism instance.

terms.name: organismScope
terms.title: Organism Scope
terms.description: A description of the kind of Organism instance. Can be used to indicate whether the Organism instance represents a discrete organism or if it represents a particular type of aggregation. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: originalNameUsage
terms.title: Original Name Usage
terms.description: The taxon name, with authorship and date information if known, as it originally appeared when first established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode. The basionym (botany) or basonym (bacteriology) of the scientificName or the senior/earlier homonym for replaced names.

terms.name: originalNameUsageID
terms.title: Original Name Usage ID
terms.description: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) in which the terminal element of the scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated nomenclaturalCode.

terms.name: otherCatalogNumbers
terms.title: Other Catalog Numbers
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same Occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

terms.name: ownerInstitutionCode
terms.title: Owner Institution Code
terms.description: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.

terms.name: parentEventID
terms.title: Parent Event ID
terms.description: An identifier for the broader Event that groups this and potentially other Events.

terms.name: parentNameUsage
terms.title: Parent Name Usage
terms.description: The full name, with authorship and date information if known, of the direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific element of the scientificName.

terms.name: parentNameUsageID
terms.title: Parent Name Usage ID
terms.description: An identifier for the name usage (documented meaning of the name according to a source) of the direct, most proximate higher-rank parent taxon (in a classification) of the most specific element of the scientificName.

terms.name: phylum
terms.title: Phylum
terms.description: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the taxon is classified.

terms.name: pointRadiusSpatialFit
terms.title: Point Radius Spatial Fit
terms.description: The ratio of the area of the point-radius (decimalLatitude, decimalLongitude, coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given point-radius does not completely contain the original representation. The pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left blank) if the original representation is a point without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same point (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1.

terms.name: preparations
terms.title: Preparations
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen.

terms.name: PreservedSpecimen
terms.title: Preserved Specimen
terms.description: A specimen that has been preserved.

terms.name: previousIdentifications
terms.title: Previous Identifications
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous assignments of names to the Organism.

terms.name: recordedBy
terms.title: Recorded By
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (recordNumber), should be listed first.

terms.name: recordNumber
terms.title: Record Number
terms.description: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.

terms.name: relatedResourceID
terms.title: Related Resource ID
terms.description: An identifier for a related resource (the object, rather than the subject of the relationship).

terms.name: relationshipAccordingTo
terms.title: Relationship According To
terms.description: The source (person, organization, publication, reference) establishing the relationship between the two resources.

terms.name: relationshipEstablishedDate
terms.title: Relationship Established Date
terms.description: The date-time on which the relationship between the two resources was established. Recommended best practice is to use an encoding scheme, such as ISO 8601:2004(E).

terms.name: relationshipOfResource
terms.title: Relationship Of Resource
terms.description: The relationship of the resource identified by relatedResourceID to the subject (optionally identified by the resourceID). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: relationshipRemarks
terms.title: Relationship Remarks
terms.description: Comments or notes about the relationship between the two resources.

terms.name: reproductiveCondition
terms.title: Reproductive Condition
terms.description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: resourceID
terms.title: Resource ID
terms.description: An identifier for the resource that is the subject of the relationship.

terms.name: ResourceRelationship
terms.title: Resource Relationship
terms.description: A relationship of one rdfs:Resource (http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Resource) to another.

terms.name: resourceRelationshipID
terms.title: Resource Relationship ID
terms.description: An identifier for an instance of relationship between one resource (the subject) and another (relatedResource, the object).

terms.name: samplingEffort
terms.title: Sampling Effort
terms.description: The amount of effort expended during an Event.

terms.name: samplingProtocol
terms.title: Sampling Protocol
terms.description: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event.

terms.name: sampleSizeValue
terms.title: Sampling Size Value
terms.description: A numeric value for a measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

terms.name: sampleSizeUnit
terms.title: Sampling Size Unit
terms.description: The unit of measurement of the size (time duration, length, area, or volume) of a sample in a sampling event.

terms.name: scientificName
terms.title: Scientific Name
terms.description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the IdentificationQualifier term.

terms.name: scientificNameAuthorship
terms.title: Scientific Name Authorship
terms.description: The authorship information for the scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable nomenclaturalCode.

terms.name: scientificNameID
terms.title: Scientific Name ID
terms.description: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

terms.name: sex
terms.title: Sex
terms.description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: specificEpithet
terms.title: Specific Epithet
terms.description: The name of the first or species epithet of the scientificName.

terms.name: startDayOfYear
terms.title: Start Day Of Year
terms.description: The earliest ordinal day of the year on which the Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

terms.name: stateProvince
terms.title: State Province
terms.description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the Location occurs.

terms.name: subgenus
terms.title: Subgenus
terms.description: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the taxon is classified. Values should include the genus to avoid homonym confusion.

terms.name: Taxon
terms.title: Taxon
terms.description: A group of organisms (sensu http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OBI_0100026) considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit.

terms.name: taxonConceptID
terms.title: Taxon Concept ID
terms.description: An identifier for the taxonomic concept to which the record refers - not for the nomenclatural details of a taxon.

terms.name: taxonID
terms.title: Taxon ID
terms.description: An identifier for the set of taxon information (data associated with the Taxon class). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

terms.name: taxonomicStatus
terms.title: Taxonomic Status
terms.description: The status of the use of the scientificName as a label for a taxon. Requires taxonomic opinion to define the scope of a taxon. Rules of priority then are used to define the taxonomic status of the nomenclature contained in that scope, combined with the experts opinion. It must be linked to a specific taxonomic reference that defines the concept. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: taxonRank
terms.title: Taxon Rank
terms.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: taxonRemarks
terms.title: Taxon Remarks
terms.description: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.

terms.name: typeStatus
terms.title: Type Status
terms.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

terms.name: verbatimCoordinates
terms.title: Verbatim Coordinates
terms.description: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

terms.name: verbatimCoordinateSystem
terms.title: Verbatim Coordinate System
terms.description: The spatial coordinate system for the verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude or the verbatimCoordinates of the Location. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

terms.name: verbatimDepth
terms.title: Verbatim Depth
terms.description: The original description of the depth below the local surface.

terms.name: verbatimElevation
terms.title: Verbatim Elevation
terms.description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

terms.name: verbatimEventDate
terms.title: Verbatim EventDate
terms.description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.

terms.name: verbatimLatitude
terms.title: Verbatim Latitude
terms.description: The verbatim original latitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

terms.name: verbatimLocality
terms.title: Verbatim Locality
terms.description: The original textual description of the place.

terms.name: verbatimLongitude
terms.title: Verbatim Longitude
terms.description: The verbatim original longitude of the Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in verbatimCoordinateSystem.

terms.name: verbatimSRS
terms.title: Verbatim SRS
terms.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude, or verbatimCoordinates are based. Recommended best practice is use the EPSG code as a controlled vocabulary to provide an SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value "unknown".

terms.name: verbatimTaxonRank
terms.title: Verbatim Taxon Rank
terms.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName as it appears in the original record.

terms.name: vernacularName
terms.title: Vernacular Name
terms.description: A common or vernacular name.

terms.name: waterBody
terms.title: Water Body
terms.description: The name of the water body in which the Location occurs. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.

terms.name: year
terms.title: Year
terms.description: The four-digit year in which the Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.
